alert.note: Alert for Saint Croix (Virgin Islands) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 18 at 12:26PM AST until September 18 at 2:30PM AST by NWS San Juan
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Juan has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Saint Croix County in Virgin Islands... * Until 230 PM AST. * At 1226 PM AST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain continued to develop and cross the warned area. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area with the additional rainbands. Urban Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms with heavy rains producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Grove Place, Frederiksted South, Christiansted and Frederiksted. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
